result.execSummary:
The defendant Kaleb K Thompson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.
DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours with Standard Release Conditions - To commence March 13, 2015 by 6:00 p.m.

Defendant Kaleb K Thompson in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Prosecuting attorney moves to strike the repeater from Count 1.  Court grants motion.  Repeater struck from Count 1.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 dismissed and read in.

Court orders the following:
- Sentence withheld
- 2 years 6 months Probation. 
- Court costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived
- Conditions of Probation:  Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.  Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs.  No use or possession of alcohol/drug paraphernalia/drugs without a valid prescription.  Attend a minimum of 2 self help meetings per week.  
CONDITION TIME: 6 months - NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence March 13, 2015 by 6:00 pm.
